summary: This is an email from Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers to defense attorneys Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Mennin regarding the upcoming jury selection in the case United States v. Maxwell. It attaches a list of prospective jurors who will return for peremptory strikes on November 29, 2021, and notes that the jury department will not excuse remaining jurors until the jury is sworn in.

events.title: Peremptory Strike Exercise for Jury Selection
events.description: The date set for the exercise of peremptory strikes in the jury selection process for the case United States v. Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is an email from Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers to defense counsel Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Mennin regarding jury selection in US v. Maxwell.
It attaches a list of prospective jurors who will return for peremptory strikes on November 29, 2021.
The jury department will not excuse remaining jurors from service until the jury is sworn in, indicating a cautious procedural approach.
The case referenced is 20cr330, United States v. Maxwell, confirming it is part of the criminal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell.
